metadata.title: CVE-2020-6463 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 81.0.4044.122 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6463` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
